author: R Srikanth
text:
No shelters or toilets are available for MTC staffers too

Services to areas such as Mathur MMDA, Tiruvottiyur and Ennore are operated from the terminus— Photo: K. Pichumani

Commuters boarding Metropolitan Transport Corporation (MTC) buses at Esplanade junction bus terminus are extremely unhappy with the way the facility is being maintained.

The terminus was originally a facility of the State Express Transport Corporation (SETC) which operated long-distance buses from there. However, ever since such services began to be operated from the Chennai Moffusil Bus Terminus (CMBT) in Koyambedu, the Esplanade junction has been used by the MTC.

The terminus, located adjacent to Madras High Court, has no shelters either for passengers or for the MTC crew.

Temporary measure

Commuters, drivers and conductors too complain that in the absence of toilets, they suffer considerably. The crew also said the roads inside the terminus were very poor and had not been re-laid in many years.

M. Satish, resident of Thandavarayan Street in Royapuram, said that as a temporary measure, authorities had filled up the road with gravel and mud, and swirls of dust would go up every time a bus entered or left the terminus.

While the main Broadway bus terminus is located on N.S.C. Bose Road, the MTC operates a few buses bound for north Chennai, including those to Mathur MMDA, Tiruvottiyur, Ennore and Manali, from this small terminus, MTC staff said.

The crew say the roads inside the terminus have not been re-laid in a long time
title: Lack of amenities at Esplanade terminus irks passengers
